Articles.Content:
Hello all,

ist just an early peak on my "Gundam K".

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Operating:

Turning arms sideways (shoulder)

turning ellbows

rotating hip

unfolding wings (actually working on)

Gunzzzz they can be turned upwards

planned:

flying capabilities

moar gunz

Walking?

Big thanks to all modders who made that thingy possible:

Mods i used:

MechJeb to Keep the weight low

Spherical fuel tanks for shoulders/Balance weight

ofc the epicly infernal robotics

Kosmos

AIES

Navigation lights

pirated weaponry

hope i mentioned all

Ill work on it tonight again, maybe you have already done sth. along These lines? Show em

Uhm, how do i embed imgur Albums?

Album embedded.

Edited August 15, 2013 by Tyren

Impressive...

use the [*imgur] link [*/imgur] to link your photo. remove the *.

I know he is not very beautiful (despite less useful)...i hope i can polish him up this evening

Suggestions or visual improvements are appreciated.

Sidenote: if anyone has an idea to get that Thing walk, just state it here.

Edited August 15, 2013 by Tyren

Looks like a Guncannon to me.

Also, Gundams don't have wings.

They have jetpacks and beam sabers.

Edited August 15, 2013 by DJEN
Silly me!

Sidenote: if anyone has an idea to get that Thing walk, just state it here.

Add more reaction wheels, they'll help.

Looks like a Guncannon to me.

Also, Gundams don't have wings.

They have jetpacks and beam sabers.

They also have beam rifles and big shields, making the name GunDam make sense.

Thanks for the further Input...the AIES decoupler tubes are just placeholders to have an idea about the shape of that guy...and yes, i can and will build jetpacks on it

Something along These lines, well not that pretty though.
Is it even safe to use fuel tanks as legs? And walk on them?

Well, it doesnt walk so far. I used the tanks to have a very low CoM, to test the operating functions. It ll get structural legs in a few hours (i am still at work -.-).

Just not sure about to modelling that legs. Maybe i let them be as design, but not working (half-craft-sized landing gear ftw ).

Someone an idea about senseful reaction wheel Placement? I plan to have the CoM and the CoL at the height of the chest...

Edited August 16, 2013 by Tyren
This is probably one of the coolest things I've seen

it not just about placement of the CoM you need to workout a way to keep the CoM over ther leg your walking on, i tried making a bi-pedal mech a few weeks back but i couldnt figure out a way to keep everything moving together, next time you get up to walk pay attention to the tiny movement you make in your feet hips and core, thats the best way i can describe on how to get it to work. if you want i could dig up so old pictures of what didnt work. Added some more pics to that Album...still not functional, gotta do way more tweaking. ^^

After some more testing runs...

Ill Focus at flyability first. Making that Thing walk is oout of my range atm.

Tonight ill improve the "airborness" of that "vessel".

But it Looks a lot cooler than its prototype

Further Investigation:

CoT doesnt intersect the CoM in Extension --> stability goes to Zero

CoL is turned back-upwards, the CoM is below(!) it --> see previous

The legs are wobbly, gotta do solid ones. Maybe i can use them to rearange my CoM

Question after reaction wheels still pending...

This is probably one of the coolest things I've seen

Thank you...ill be glad if itd work as it Looks

Edited August 16, 2013 by Tyren

Thanks for the further Input...the AIES decoupler tubes are just placeholders to have an idea about the shape of that guy...and yes, i can and will build jetpacks on it

-Insert surreal wing zero here-

Something along These lines, well not that pretty though.

Looking forwards to it.
